results.title: Dealing with Discipline Problems (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dave Bell Associates and Jim Thornton
results.brief_description: A dozen discipline situations filmed at three of Dr Glasser’s model “schools without failure” demonstrates how teachers apply “success concepts” of reality therapy in everyday practice.

results.title: Dealing with difficult people
results.brief_description: The aim of this video-based training program is to inform participants about four fundamental techniques which will enable them to deal with difficult people. The techniques can be applied to everyday contexts within the home and workplace. A manual which complements the video can be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Dealing with difficult behaviour
results.brief_description: This video deals with the problem of difficult people in the workplace, whether they be co-workers, senior management, customers or clients and shows some effective strategies in dealing with such people. Dramatised situations are portrayed with the main character, Jane, a customer relations officer, seen in a range of scenarios, both external and internal. A 49 page training program accompanies this title. Cast includes James Armstrong, Madelaine James, Batholomew John, Katherine McCallum, Helen McGrath, Kate Randall, Cameron Sharp and Nicholas Tsakonas.

results.title: Dealing with death
results.creator_credit: Motorola Teleprograms, Filmmakers and Perry Schwartz
results.brief_description: Looks at the problems of stress which face police officers, focusing on the effect of confrontation with death. Presents realistic examples of police officers reacting to stress. A useful tool in helping students to anticipate the effects of stress and to counteract them.

results.title: Dealing with Alzheimer's Disease: a commonsense approach to communication
results.creator_credit: Karen Feldt, Ramsey Foundation and Terra Nova
results.brief_description: Alzheimer’s Disease often produces memory loss and gradual changes in abilities to think, plan and communicate. Family members who are caregivers are often frustrated by these losses. This video is designed to help caregivers by providing information about these losses, teaching verbal and non-verbal communication techniques, describing common behaviour changes and providing suggestions to prevent or reduce problem behaviours.

results.title: Deakin's pipe dream
results.brief_description:
A montage of archival photographic images superimposed with live action footage to present a vision of Federation and irrigation in the Sunraysia region of Victoria. Without dialogue and accompanied only by background sound effects.
Developed during the Alfred Deakin Federation Project, 2001 and supported by the Centenary of Federation Victoria and the Community Support Fund through the Victorian Federation Grants Scheme, and the Mildura City Council.

results.title: Deaf like me
results.brief_description: The story of Yollie, a shy, withdrawn deaf child, and her meeting with a mime. Yollie is entranced by Jeff, a mime artist who comes to perform for her class. Jeff teaches her some mime routines and they perform together for the whole school. As Yollie says goodbye to Jeff she discovers that he too has a hearing problem.

results.title: Deaf Culture (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Adult Hearing Centre for Deaf and Hearing Impaired Persons
results.brief_description: Hearing people ask: What is it? What does it mean? Can we really speak about Deaf culture? Steve Ripley knows the worlds of the hearing and the deaf. He has travelled widely and tells his experiences in vivid sign language. A voice interpreter and subtitles are provided for those not fluent in sign language.

results.title: Deadly spiders
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Wild Life”.
Illustrates and describes several species of spiders, some of which, although appearing most frightening, are quite harmless. The film warns against the poisonous varieties, such as the red-back and the deadly funnel web spiders. The spinneret fangs, poison sacs, and eyes of the funnel web are shown in detail. First aid treatment of a bite by a spider is demonstrated. The film also makes suggestions on how to preserve those species of spiders which are beneficial to man.
